original_title: ASPI exceeds 22,000 point mark as bourse’s bullish exuberance continues
original_body_lines: CSE activities continued with their bullish exuberance yesterday when the IMF made positive observations on the Sri Lankan economy at an on line media conference. Subsequent positive economic indicators were attributed to this upward trend, such as the ASPI going beyond the 22,000 point mark.
Besides the S&P SL20 index, which tracks the top 20 largest and most liquid stocks on the stock market, crossed 6,200 points during trading hours.
The stock market hit a new record in the first half hour of trading when the All Share Price Index went beyond the 22,000 points mark.
The All Share Price Index went up by 143 points, while the S and P SL20 rose by 41.4 points. Turnover stood at Rs 9.7 billion with 17 crossings.

Top seven crossings were; Lanka Credit and Business, 135 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 878 million and its shares traded at Rs 6.50, Commercial Bank 2.95 million shares crossed for Rs 572 million and its shares traded at Rs 194, DFCC 1.1 million shares crossed for Rs 185.9 million and its shares traded at Rs 164, Sanasa Developments Bank 3.2 million shares crossed for Rs 158 million; its shares traded at Rs 50, Dipped Products 1.78 million shares crossed for Rs 125 million; its shares sold at Rs 70. Pan Asia Bank 1.5 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 98.5 million; its shares sold at Rs 66 and Distilleries 1.5 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 90 million; its shares traded at Rs 60.

In the retail market companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; CT Holdings Rs 685 million (one million shares traded), Lanka Credit and Business Rs 534 million (70.1 million shares traded), Dipped Products Rs 525 million (7.5 million shares traded), JKH Rs 274 million (12.5 million shares traded), Commercial Bank Rs 256 million (1.3 million shares traded), Pan Asia Bank Rs 196 million (three million shares traded). During the day 439 million shares volumes changed hands in 44242 transactions.
It is said that the banking sector performed well, especially Commercial Bank, while the manufacturing sector, especially Dipped Products, performed well too at the floor.
Yesterday the rupee opened at 302.45/55 to the US dollar, from Rs 302.46/52 the previous day, while bond yields were broadly steady, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.02.2028 was quoted at 9.00/10 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.10.2028 was quoted at 9.20/25 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.06.2029 was quoted at 9.55/65 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted at 9.68/75 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2030 was quoted at 9.73/80 percent, up from 9.75/80 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.11.2033 was quoted at 10.70/80 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.45/60 percent, down from 10.50/60 percent.

The telegraphic transfer rates for the American dollar was 299.0000 buying, 306.0000 selling; the British pound was 400.9977 buying, and 412.3595 selling, and the euro was 348.3761 buying, 359.7393 selling.
